meanings.definition: A tightly stretched wire or cable used for acrobatic performances.
meanings.sent1: The acrobat gracefully balanced on the tightwire during the circus show.
meanings.sent2: The tightwire was the highlight of the acrobatic performance.
meanings.sent3: The clown tried to walk on the tightwire but ended up doing cartwheels instead.
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like walking a tightwire, always on the edge of falling.
meanings.sent5: The tightwire shimmered under the spotlight, drawing all eyes to its daring challenge.

meanings.definition: To perform acrobatic feats on a tightwire.
meanings.sent1: She trained for years to tightwire across the stage with grace.
meanings.sent2: The acrobat will tightwire over the audience with skill and precision.
meanings.sent3: The penguin decided to tightwire across the iceberg for fun.
meanings.sent4: Balancing work and family is like trying to tightwire through a storm.
meanings.sent5: He tightwired his way through the obstacles, never losing his focus.
